1.directions: Welcome to the pipetting lab. In this lab, we will practice proper micropipetting techniques

2.description: Select the micropipette that will be used
2.directions: Our first task will be to select the appropriate micropipette.

3.directions: Micropipettes are calibrated to different ranges. 0.2-2ul for P2 pipettes, 2ul-20ul for P20 pipettes, 20-200ul for P200 pipettes, and 200ul-1000ul for P1000 pipettes.

4.directions: Now, we'll give you a volume in microliters and you will need to identify which pipette would be appropriate to extract that volume.
4.user_instructions: Hint: the pipette type is always given on the top of the push button.

5.directions: Select the appropriate pipette for the given volume: 1ul.
5.user_instructions: Hint: Try rotating your camera to view the top of the pipette to see their volume!

6.description: Instruct user on how to set the pipette volume
6.directions: Good job! Now lets work on setting the volume on the pipette!
6.user_instructions: Remember, rotating clockwise (to the right) increases volume, whereas rotating counterclockwise (to the left) decreases the volume.

7.directions: Set the volume of the pipette to extract 1ul.
7.user_instructions: Use the right arrow to rotate the push button counterclockwise and the left arrow to rotate the push button clockwise.

8.description: Instruct user on how to select the right tip
8.directions: Good Job! Now let us look at identifying the correct tip holder box.

9.directions: Different micropipettes require different-sized disposable tips. Red = P2, Orange = P20, Yellow = P200, Blue = P1OOO.
9.user_instructions: Please select the appropriate tip. Hint: we selected a P2 micropipette!

10.directions: Well done! Let's now attach the tip. To attach the pipette tip you must simply push the pipette into the tip holder until the tip is attached.
10.user_instructions: Move the joystick down until the pipette hits the tip box to attach the tip to the pipette!

11.directions: Awesome! Now that we have set the volume on the pipette we can now look at extracting the given volume of a reagent.

12.directions: To extract liquid, first press the plunger to the first stop.
12.user_instructions: Adjust the push button slider until you reach the first stop.

13.directions: While holding the plunger, insert the tip into the liquid just below the meniscus.

14.directions: Then, we release the push button slowly to start extracting the liquid.
14.user_instructions: Slowly move the joystick up, allowing the plunger to return to its original position to draw up the liquid.

15.directions: Good job! Now that we've extracted the liquid, let us dump the liquid out into this beaker.
15.user_instructions: Use the joystick to press the plunger all the way to the second stop and slowly release to expel the liquid.

16.description: Instruct user on how to dispose of used pipette tips
16.directions: Almost there! Now, all we have left to do is dispose of the pipette tip! After using your pipette it is always good practice to eject the tip into an appropriate waste disposal box.

17.directions: To eject the tip you must push down on the tip ejector button shown on the pipette.
17.user_instructions: Use the joystick to push down on the tip ejector and eject the pipette tip!

18.directions: Great work scientist! You have now learned the basics of using a micropipette!
